definitions.definition: A dark image projected onto a surface where light (or other radiation ) is blocked by the shade of an object.
examples: My shadow lengthened as the sun began to set.
The X-ray showed a shadow on his lung.

definitions.definition: Relative darkness , especially as caused by the interruption of light ; gloom ; obscurity .
examples: I immediately jumped into shadow as I saw them approach.

definitions.definition: An area protected by an obstacle (likened to an object blocking out sunlight).
examples: The mountains block the passage of rain-producing weather systems and cast a " shadow " of dryness behind them.

definitions.definition: A reflected image, as in a mirror or in water.
That which looms as though a shadow.
examples: I lived in her shadow my whole life.
He did not give even a shadow of respect to the professor.
I don't have a shadow of doubt in my mind that my plan will succeed.
He came back from war the shadow of a man.
The neopagan ritual was only a pale shadow of the ones the Greeks held thousands of years ago.

definitions.definition: A trainee , assigned to work with an experienced officer.
One who secretly or furtively follows another.
examples: The constable was promoted to working as a shadow for the Royals.

definitions.definition: A drop shadow effect applied to lettering in word processors etc.
An influence, especially a pervasive or a negative one.
A spirit ; a ghost ; a shade .
An uninvited guest accompanying one who was invited.
An unconscious aspect of the personality .

main_definition: A dark image projected onto a surface where light (or other radiation ) is blocked by the shade of an object.
secondary_definitions: Relative darkness , especially as caused by the interruption of light ; gloom ; obscurity .
An area protected by an obstacle (likened to an object blocking out sunlight).
( obsolete or poetic ) A reflected image, as in a mirror or in water.
( figurative ) That which looms as though a shadow.
( chiefly in the negative ) A small degree; a shade .
( UK , law enforcement ) A trainee , assigned to work with an experienced officer.
One who secretly or furtively follows another.
( typography ) A drop shadow effect applied to lettering in word processors etc.
An influence, especially a pervasive or a negative one.
A spirit ; a ghost ; a shade .
( obsolete , Latinism ) An uninvited guest accompanying one who was invited.
( Jungian psychology ) An unconscious aspect of the personality .
